content:
Vlad Korobov said:

1. Collapsed compose box

The main button looks like an input. Doesn't look disabled. There is a link to Drafts.

image.png

The actually looks a bit disabled to me at least when looking at the image in the lightbox. I would consider darkening the label a bit more.
A message was moved here from #design > UI redesign: compose box by Tim Abbott.

The only other thing I'm worried about with the closed compose box experience is whether will be sad that there's no way to make a new private message directly in this redesign.

I suspect we will find that some users will have weird adaptations like clicking on random users in the right sidebar and then changing the recipient of the compose box that gets opened; that might feel like less work than opening the compose box for a stream and then changing to a private message recipient type.

I suppose if we hear complaints, we can add something inside a \vdots menu at the far right or something similarly subtle.

I don't see a cheap way to figure out whether this will prove to be a real issue. I personally use the x keyboard shortcut to start new private messages while looking at a stream a few times a week, but anecdotally, I am not sure I know of anyone who regularly clicks the current "New private message" button with equivalent functionality.

I think other than those two things, this looks great to me. I think both are things where just trying the change as designed would be a reasonable next step, though I think if we are not going to have a "New private message" button hidden somewhere, integrating this change is blocked on adding the ability to change message types in the open compose box.

I am not sure I know of anyone who regularly clicks the current "New private message" button

Exactly. From y observation people don't click New PM button.
Here is what I observed when I ask a person neat their computer to write a DM to me:

  1. Looking on the right panel and hovering the mouse to catch my name - no quick luck here, because people names are jumping due to status change and we have like 30 people. Searching here doesn't feel like a quick thing, but I saw some times people do that.
  2. Change of tactic :smile: Lets look in the list of previous DMs... hm, there is no me there in the top 5 recent and expanding the list looks like accepting the failure in the task of I can do it quickly

  3. Jumping in the last conversation a person saw me participating in some stream and clicking my name there then clicking DMs with that person... there is a confusion here too because both options start with the same word View: image.png

  4. If there was no luck in 1-3 I want to instruct a person to do a heavy lifting. People reluctant to do that, but I insist:
    "Ctrl + K and type Vlad and select Private messages with Vlad". After doing that a person see the success and very surprised about such amazing approach. It doesn't change instantly what they do next time for the same task because it is a habit and doesn't look snappy because you have to arrow down multiple times since DMs with a person are not at the top of the search. We do need a good Jump menu... which is a separate discussion.

I agree that there is a confusion about input field, since it is not telling it is universal but placeholder suggests to compose to a particular place while a user might want to do a DM. The only thing I can suggest here to include that button on hover.

image.png
image.png

there is a confusion here too because both options start with the same word View: image.png

In theory, they shouldn't be using either of those options. We have "Send private message".
I think once you know it, the x shortcut and typing in the person's name (with auto-complete) is the most convenient option for sending a PM.

The only thing I can suggest here to include that button on hover.

Hm, interesting. I wonder if it would help, or if it would be just as invisible as the current "New private message" button.
I have never used x or new private message button since I always like to see previous messages before sending a message. So, I usually try to narrow to the PM using left or right sidebar.
I sometimes use x + ctrl + . or the "go to conversation" button for that.
I would still prefer to use w + type Tim and enter. Feels more reliable somehow.
Heh, I didn't know that keyboard shortcut. :)
